alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 7:31PM EST until December 27 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Henderson and Buncombe Counties. .Rainfall has largely ended across the river basin but runoff from earlier heavier rainfall continues to produce elevated river levels. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. The French Broad River has exceeded bankfull at the gauge site. Isolated farmland flooding continues across the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below 10 feet Wednesday morning and then continue falling to around 8 feet by Wednesday evening. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 800 AM EST.
